original_solution_mapping.L1: Monty needs to feed 36 family members and each chicken/meal combo feeds 6 people so he needs 36/6 = <<36/6=6>>6 combos
original_solution_mapping.L2: Each chicken/meal combo costs $12.00 and he needs 6 so it will cost him 12*6 = $<<12*6=72.00>>72.00 to feed everyone

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1180.
    Returns: the total cost to feed everyone.
    """
    # L1
    num_family_members = 36 # 36 family members
    people_per_combo = 6 # feed 6 people
    num_combos = num_family_members / people_per_combo

    # L2
    cost_per_combo = 12.00 # $12.00
    total_cost = cost_per_combo * num_combos

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Monty needs to feed {num_family_members} family members and each chicken/meal combo feeds {people_per_combo} people so he needs {num_family_members}/{people_per_combo} = <<{num_family_members}/{people_per_combo}={num_combos}>>{num_combos} combos

Each chicken/meal combo costs ${cost_per_combo} and he needs {num_combos} so it will cost him {cost_per_combo}*{num_combos} = $<<{cost_per_combo}*{num_combos}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} to feed everyone

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Monty needs to feed 6 family members and each chicken/meal combo feeds 6 people so he needs 6/6 = <<6/6=1>>1 combos
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Each chicken/meal combo costs $12 and he needs 1 so it will cost him 12*1 = $<<12*1=12>>12 to feed everyone

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'people_per_combo' (6) was used instead of 'num_family_members' (36).
